timeline.bodyText: Why here use GroupByTimePlan to replace the former ones? GroupByTimePlan contains some useless info that will waste some memory space.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

replies.bodyText: u're right. It's been rolled back

timeline.bodyText: timestamp is the a cached timestamp for all sensors in this query, it may not be the current one which is needed to fill value.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: You don't need to consider the ascending case, the peekNextNotNullValue method will only be used in desc case.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

timeline.bodyText: It seems that this timestamp is useless, we don't need to put it back to cachedTimestamps.
timeline.author: JackieTien97

replies.bodyText: i think we need put it back , for example , the interval is [0,10) , [10,20), [20,30), if the first cache is 30 ,and the end time is 10, so that need put back
replies.author: liutaohua

timeline.bodyText:
It seems there will be IndexOutOfArrayException here.
What if cachedTimestamps's size is larger than timeStampFetchSize. And also, you call the constructTimeArrayForOneCal method in the following and fetch another timeStampFetchSize timestamp, i think it should be changed in case of desc.
